JOB SUMMARY

Grow with us as HR workstream Project Assistant.

You will be part of the European HR Transformation project team, specifically the Process & Policy workstream. You will support the workstream in the coordination of HR Process & policy related activities across Europe, working in close partnership with internal Subject Matter Experts.

You will have experience in supporting the delivery of complex transformation projects in a multinational environment, in partnership with internal HR Transformation workstreams, global project teams, HR subject matter experts, etc.

WHAT WILL I BE DOING?

When joining the European HR Transformation project team, you will be a member of the Process and Policy workstream and your main tasks will be: 
Engage and partner with Kellogg Subject Matter Experts to gather and develop detailed procedure documentation and policies for HR processes across all European countries
Explore options and potential ideas to build and implement a new European policy portal 
Support internal project by managing a large amount of data and information for reporting and tracking
Support ad hoc project activities as and when required
Support the delivery of project milestones by undertaking project co-ordination activities
Be an active member of the European HR transformation team, working in partnership with the global project team

WHAT DO I NEED TO DEMONSTRATE?

Required:
Bachelor/Master Degree or equivalent plus relevant business qualification 
Experience in Human Resources, ideally HR shared services
Project Management experience ideally linked to HR processes
Experience in working across multiple countries and cultures
Ability to monitor, prioritize and resolve issues
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Proactive and follow through attitude
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft (Excel, PowerPoint, Visio , etc)
Ideally good knowledge of HR systems i.e. SAP, Taleo, Success Factors
Highly motivated and able to work in a fast changing, dynamic environment
Able to work in a multi-cultural and multi-disciplined team
Excellent team player 
WHAT ELSE DO I NEED TO KNOW?

Significant amount of travel across Europe will be required for the role.

This role is 6 to 9 months Fixed-term contract.

Fluency in English is required. Another European language is a plus.

Please note that we will only accept applications that are made to us via our Careers site.

If you experience any difficulty when applying please contact hrsharedservice@kellogg.com.

Please note that the closing date may be subject to change. We will interview suitable candidates as they apply, so please don’t hesitate to take this opportunity to submit your application as soon as possible.

If you would like to be immediately notified of new Kellogg's opportunities, please go to ‘Create or access my profile’ and complete the information required in the ‘Job Alerts’ section. You will then receive email alerts as soon as new jobs are advertised.

The Kellogg Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer who strives to provide an inclusive work environment that involves everyone and embraces the diverse talent of its people.
title: HR Project Assistant, Process and Policy 6-9 months
